body.description: Save counter space with this compact, 0.9 cubic foot microwave oven from West Bend. The perfect countertop microwave for the dorm, man cave, office, studio apartment, RV, tiny home, rental room, condo, vacation home, or anywhere you need to cook food fast. This small microwave features 900 watts of cooking power, touchpad controls, 6 pre-set cooking modes, 10 power levels, and a removable glass turntable, all in its compact footprint that fits perfectly on the countertop.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: West Bend 0.9 cu. ft.​ Microwave Oven​ West Bend offers a variety of countertop microwave ovens that make your busy lives a breeze, while providing fun and stylish options to match your décor. With multiple cooking and heating options, it’s effortless to make the perfect bag of popcorn or defrost frozen veggies and meat straight from the freezer. ​ ​This 0.9 cu. ft. microwave is energy efficient yet powerful enough to cook and reheat all your favorite foods and beverages. The compact design offers a convenient, space-saving solution, great for smaller living spaces like apartments and dorms. Available in black, white, and stainless steel.

CONVENIENT: 0.9 cu ft microwave oven is an ideal option for your home, office or any small space ONE-TOUCH PRESETS: Six pre-programmed cooking options including baked potato, popcorn, pizza, beverage, frozen dinner and reheat VERSATILE FUNCTIONS: Features speed defrost setting, cook and defrost by weight and 10 variable power levels

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Overall a really good microwave but a bit loud.
reviews.reviewText: This microwave cooks very well, the turntable moves slowly to avoid "cold spots." The controls are easy to figure out, it's easy to clean. It's got a larger round plastic wheel turning thingy... that ring thing the glass sits on, which is good because the glass is steadier than the one in my old microwave. The glass doesn't shift or get misaligned easily like my old one. A good value for the money. My only complaint and this is very, very minor is that it's a bit loud. Bah, not really an issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Product worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice for the price
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and visually appealing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Changed my mind with time. DON’T BUY IT
reviews.reviewText: I was so happy with my last west bend microwave that I decided to buy another. I love everything about it except for two things. My last west bend had a bigger interior. I can manufacturer would realize that not everyone has a newly two feet. You can’t use an extension cord so I had to rearrange and reduce my cupboard space to accommodate the cord. In my opinion they could leave the cord a little longer. The excess could remain tied behind the appliance so it can accommodate all kitchens. Aside from that I love this microwave!Adding a note. Now that we’ve been using it my son is complaining about a super high pitched noise in the kitchen. I don’t hear it because I have tinnitus really bad. But we unplugged the microwave and sure enough the noise stopped. He says it gives him a headache when he’s in the kitchen fixing something to eat. I’ll call the company and see what answers they give me. I don’t know what they can do about “white noise”.UPDATE:The noise the microwave generates is getting louder. I can hear it now over my tinnitus. It sounds like it’s coming from the clock. The manufacturer refuses to do anything about the issue. They say it’s not a manufacturer problem. However, we don’t touch the inside mechanisms. It’s never been dropped or had any accidents. It’s just simply noisy. And it’s getting worse with time.The manufacturer refuses to accept any responsibility for the issue. They won’t do anything to help me with it. So that 1 year warranty that comes with the machine is worthless.It’s beyond the 30 days so it’s not returnable to Amazon.$115 dollars for a product that causes headaches and is useless to us within 90 days!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect apartment size
reviews.reviewText: Microwave gives me all the features I need!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I originally was going to replacement my microwave (yes it still works its just big and a heavy hand me down) for a slightly smaller one. Unfortunately, this is way smaller than anticipated. The positive is you can use a timer, it does microwave well, but it does slide when you attempt to open or close the door. (I suggest a mat underneath and or weight on top. No one wants to hold the microwave in order to use it.) The noise I can tolerate in my apartment, but if you are in a dorm sized living situation then this would not be ideal. Baby bottles and food are cluttered when used, and the cord is very short. Pricepoint does not match the quality of this unit, but the ease of use are very good for the buttons.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I need it very much
reviews.reviewText: I like it very much, l use it for cooking.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good!!
reviews.reviewText: Received this microwave the other day. After an initial easy setup, I used it. Perfect. Easy to use and the beeps are not as loud as my previous West Bend zappers. Which is a plus. It also does 'reminder' beeps a couple times every minute until you actually withdraw your food item, which is nice too at least for me. I saw other reviews about how loud this microwave is and how people are unhappy with that. Well,from what I have experienced, the sound isn't as loud as my other microwaves. And seriously, who cares? This is my 3rd West Bend microwave and I am very pleased with this brand. Never had any problems. My previous microwave is still working I just wanted a black one to match my new convection oven better which is stainless with black. It looks pretty sharp on my countertop too. And no it isn't as large as other ovens I have seen either. TBH there really isn't anything that I don't like about this microwave. I also purch'd Asurion just in case. I dont foresee this oven going south on me though. Buy it. You'll like it!
